meanings.definition: Overturing (verb): to overturn or turn over
meanings.sent1: She was overturing the soil in the garden.
meanings.sent2: The strong wind was overturing the trash cans.
meanings.sent3: The cat was overturing the neatly stacked books for fun.
meanings.sent4: The storm was overturing everything in its path.
meanings.sent5: The earthquake was overturing buildings like they were toys.

meanings.definition: Overturing (noun): the act of overturning or turning over
meanings.sent1: The overturing of the boat caused everyone to fall into the water.
meanings.sent2: The overturing of the vase shattered it into pieces.
meanings.sent3: The overturing of the cake made a mess, but it was still delicious.
meanings.sent4: The overturing of the market prices led to chaos in the economy.
meanings.sent5: The overturing of the apple cart was a sight to behold.
